summary: Completed comprehensive testing of crypto wallet builder app. Backend APIs mostly functional with Web3 RPC timeout issues. Frontend has critical clipboard permission error blocking user interactions.

critical_bugs.issue: Web3 RPC calls to https://eth.llamarpc.com timeout after 60+ seconds

minor_issues.issue: Returns 500 Internal Server Error instead of 400 Bad Request for invalid addresses

critical_bugs.issue: Clipboard API fails with 'Write permission denied' error, causing uncaught runtime error overlay that blocks all interactions
critical_bugs.impact: Completely breaks user experience after first copy attempt

integration_issues.flow: All copy functionality (wallet addresses, private keys, contract code)
integration_issues.issue: No error handling for clipboard permission failures

passed_tests: Landing page loads with Obsidian Forge theme
Navigation between all pages works correctly
Wallet creation generates valid Ethereum addresses and private keys
Wallet import accepts valid private keys
Token creator generates ERC-20 smart contract code
AI contract writer generates contracts using GPT-5.2
All form inputs and buttons are clickable and functional
Backend API endpoints respond correctly (except balance check)
Database operations for wallets and tokens work
AI integration with Emergent LLM works properly

success_percentage.backend: 80% (8/10 tests passed - balance timeout and error code issues)
success_percentage.frontend: 60% (major functionality works but clipboard error breaks UX)

critical: Fix clipboard permission error by adding proper error handling and fallback methods (e.g., select text for manual copy)
Investigate Web3 RPC timeout issues - consider using different RPC provider or adding timeout handling
recommended: Add proper error status codes (400 vs 500) for validation errors
Add loading states for slow operations like balance checking
Consider adding offline mode or cached balance display
